properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 9:35PM EST until February 12 at 3:43PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...

Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties

Yellow River near East Lithonia affecting De Kalb and Rockdale
Counties

Yellow River near Conyers below Milstead affecting Newton and
Rockdale Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Yellow River near East Lithonia.
* From tomorrow morning until Wednesday afternoon.
* At 845 PM Monday the stage was 4.4 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 13 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage by late Tuesday
morning and then continue rising, reaching near 15.2 feet by
Tuesday evening. The river is expected to fall below flood stage by
late Wednesday morning.
* At 13 feet, minor flooding will occur in portions of the woodlands
and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on
Pleasant Hill Road.

At 15 feet, minor flooding expands further into the woodlands and
fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on
Pleasant Hill Road. In DeKalb County, some flooding of backyards of
homes will begin on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek
flowing under Union Grove Road into the river begins to back up.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Wednesday afternoon
